column3:
Jake wanted to eat an orange.  He liked fruit, and the only fruits in the house were
ewlineapples, which he didn't like, oranges, and strawberries, which made him itchy.  But his
ewlinemother had put oranges on top of the refrigerator.   Jake couldn't reach the top of the
ewlinerefrigerator.  He got the stool that he used to reach things in the cupboards.   But the
ewlinestool wasn't tall enough on its own.  He thought if he stood on the edge of the kitchen
ewlinesink he could reach the oranges.  (The kitchen sink was right next to the refrigerator).
ewlineSo he used the stool to get up to the edge of the sink, and then he stood on the edge of
ewlinethe sink to get the oranges.  He took one out of the bag and then put the bag back on top
ewlineof the refrigerator.  Then he used the stool to climb back down again with his orange.  He
ewlinesat at the kitchen table, peeled the orange, and ate it.  Then he took all of the pieces
ewlineof orange peel and threw them away in the yard waste.
column4: multiple: Why doesn't using the stool work at first?
column7: it doesn't reach the edge of the sink
column8: Jake is too short to use the stool
column9: multiple: At the beginning of the story, why can't Jake get the oranges?
column10: his mother told him not to
column13: They are on top of the refrigerator, where he can't reach
column14: one: What fruit was not in the house?
column19: one: What does Jake do with the orange once he has it?
column20: Puts it back on top of the refrigerator
column21: Throws it away in the yard waste
